1.title: What's Worse Than Dead?
1.plot: Adam arrives at Jamero's house for the first time only to discover he's a hoarder. Adam, who suffers from acute OCD, is grossed out by Jamero's home but has nowhere else to go. When Jamero asks about his girlfriend, Adam breaks down crying and confesses he was dumped and has been sleeping on the couch.

2.title: C'mon Son!
2.plot: Adam, Jamero, Norm and Dan drive over to Adam's old apartment to gather his stuff when Katherine, Adams ex-girlfriend, enters with her newlywed, Dax. The showdown begins...

3.title: Free Pussy, Riot
3.plot: Adam, now living with Jamero, opens the door one morning to a beautiful woman named Jade - Jamero's childhood friend. Their introduction is less than amicable as she ridicules Adam for his surprise cleaning spree and for being a one hit pop sell out.

4.title: Osho Says
4.plot: While writing at a coffee shop, and avoiding Jamero's calls, Adam runs into his old friend and band manager, Stewart (Andrew Keegan) - who has renamed himself "Kokopelle" and claims to have reclaimed his virginity.

imdb.plot outline: Adam Anthony's world is turned upside down when his girlfriend dumps him - landing him on the couch of his new friend Jamero, his first ever African American friend. Displaced with nowhere else to go, Adam finds himself navigating through Jamero's unfamiliar and very colorful world. Inspired by the unforgettable Odd Couple sitcom, Adam & Jamero updates the classic with white and black lead actors. Through humor, Adam & Jamero turn assumptions and generalizations on their head. As the show unfolds, characters begin to understand the imperfections we all have in common.
imdb.title: Adam and Jamero
plot: Adam Anthony's world is turned upside down when his girlfriend dumps him - landing him on the couch of his new friend Jamero, his first ever African American friend. Displaced with nowhere else to go, Adam finds himself navigating through Jamero's unfamiliar and very colorful world. Inspired by the unforgettable Odd Couple sitcom, Adam & Jamero updates the classic with white and black lead actors. Through humor, Adam & Jamero turn assumptions and generalizations on their head. As the show unfolds, characters begin to understand the imperfections we all have in common.::Estée Ochoa
